Since the method described above is highly inefficient and section indexes are an important feature, it was decided to make an exception and hardcode a method to update section indexes whenever the document objects tree is update.
After an update is done, section indexes are calculated recursively from the document object. Once the index (numeric or alphabetic) is calculated it is set along the section name in the section tree element. This method is called when an updated is method is called, it has no visible impact on performance.
This feature must be refactored in the future to allow other classes to have indexes in the document objects tree.
